page.title: 14Traffic danger at Tilstock
page.content: Date line 21st. June 1985. A come up and see us sometime invit- ation has gone to a Shropshire C.C. chairman from the village.The invit- ation is part of moves by traffic troubled Tilstock,where villagers are campaigning for a 30mph speed limit on its road,or at the least "Please drive carefully"signs on its main approaches.They have obtained over 270 names to a petition in support of their call,which local C.C. Mrs Paulene Collins intended giving direct to Councillor Arther Hooke, chairman of the countys planning and transport committee.One of the pet- ition organisers Mrs P.Clorley said the main source of worry was Tilstock Lane carring traffic between the Wem/ Whitchurch and A41/49 trunk roads directly past the village school.
